result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane Michael Segner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.

miscConds.notes: To be paid during terms of probation.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Michael Segner

records.addlTxt: Clerk emailed corrected JOC to court info at GCSD

2:35 PM Defendant Shane Michael Segner in court.  Attorney Amber Day Lucsay in court for Shane Michael Segner.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Amended Information filed. No Contest plea entered. The Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. 1 year probation imposed and 90 day stayed sentence to jail.  $300 bond money applied to court costs. Defendant ordered to report to probation today. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
Clerk emailed JOC to court info at GCSD

8:41 AM Defendant Shane Michael Segner not in court.  Attorney Amber Day Lucsay in court for Shane Michael Segner.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:38 PM Shane Michael Segner, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Amber Day Lucsay. Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. The state withdraws the motion for bail/bond forfeiture. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver filed with the court. The court accepts the waiver.  Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties.  Defendant waives formal reading of information.   Not Guilty plea entered on count 1. Inducement of no additional periods of incarceration were made. Matter set over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
